docs.snippet: Banks are tightening the security of their SWIFT messaging networks – used by the industry to shift trillions of dollars each day – following revelations that hackers are increasingly able to get into this system to steal money.

headline.print_headline: Banks Tighten SWIFT System Security After Hacks
headline.main: Banks Tighten SWIFT System Security After Hacks

docs.snippet: The feast approaches, the to-do list is long. We’re charging forward. Are you?

On Saturday, the U.S. government plans to cede control of some of the internet's core systems — namely, the directories that help web browsers and apps know where to find the latest weather, maps and Facebook musings.

headline.print_headline: AP EXPLAINS: What's at Stake as US Cedes Internet Control
headline.main: AP EXPLAINS: What's at Stake as US Cedes Internet Control

docs.snippet: American internet companies have had a hard time getting into China. But Chinese internet companies have struggled to grow beyond its borders.

headline.main: Struggling to Break Out of Chinese Internet

docs.snippet: While biting tweets backfire and fake news abounds, subscriptions are on the rise in what could be journalism’s finest hour.

headline.print_headline: By Attacking the News Media,  Trump May Be Doing It a Favor
headline.main: By Attacking the Press, Donald Trump May Be Doing It a Favor

docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column thanks Pres-elect Trump for rescuing news industry from slump; notes pres-elect's attacks on media and misleading statements are increasing public's support for journalism.

docs.snippet: Thursday: Alternative workout classes to keep the holiday pounds at bay, flawless weather and a $3 subway ride.

headline.print_headline: New York Today: Flexing Your Workout
headline.main: New York Today: Flexing Your Workout

docs.snippet: Monday: The fable behind fried food on Hanukkah, wintry weather and a spelling lesson.

headline.main: New York Today: Lessons Beyond Latkes

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

headline.main: Trump, Syria, Schumer: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing

docs.snippet: Mr. Cohen, who was known for working slowly, had picked up the pace considerably in recent years. His manager said he died in his sleep after a fall.

headline.print_headline: A Burst of Activity, Then a Fall in the Night
headline.main: For Leonard Cohen, the End Came With a Fall in the Night

docs.abstract: Robert B Kory, manager of recently deceased singer-songwriter Leonard Cohen, announces Cohen died peacefully in his sleep after taking fall in middle of the night; artist had spurt of increased productivity in recent years, despite numerous health problems.
